7690bb97-95ce-4b91-984d-8bfe8c925f8f.description: The Court Face course introduces Fathers' UpLift's 13 Procedures of advocacy, discussions, and other hands-on activities to prepare Father Leaders for their role and responsibilities as National Ambassadors. The Court Face Course will also cover the following: A Father's Rights, Gathering Evidence Against False Accusations, the Role of Child Welfare, Navigating Child Support, Documenting Interactions, and completing necessary paperwork.
7690bb97-95ce-4b91-984d-8bfe8c925f8f.name: Court Face Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete 13 hours of instruction on a father's rights, supporting fathers with establishing paternity, complete child support modifications, addressing false accusations, and navigating family and probate court matters in the Court Face Course.
Learners must display that they have deepened their knowledge of various systems that interfere with a father's ability to remain physically and emotionally present in his children's lives.
Learners must demonstrate their ability to assess and navigate Family and Probate Court with fathers as National Ambassadors.
Learners must demonstrate their ability to assess and navigate issues regarding a father's involvement with the Children Welfare Department as a National Ambassador.
Learners must demonstrate their ability to assess and navigate Child Support Issues with fathers as a National Ambassador.
Learners must recognize the role they play in serving fathers nationally.
Learners must demonstrate their ability to inform fathers of their rights as parents throughout the country.
Learners must display that they have been able to deepen their knowledge of various father rights to accommodate their existing knowledge and personal experience.

5e3a0175-a2ff-4000-ba5e-1bffdc68c762.description: Learners with this Badge have completed the Managing Emotions Course. The Managing Emotions Course focuses on remaining in control of emotions such as anger, guilt, sadness, and hopelessness effectively and healthily. The Course provides opportunities for learners to recognize physical and emotional responses to difficult emotions, explore thoughts, feelings, and situations that lead to unhealthy decision-making patterns, and become equipped with the tools for forgiveness.
5e3a0175-a2ff-4000-ba5e-1bffdc68c762.name: Managing Emotions Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete a 1-hour evaluation that assesses lived experiences and emotional health.
Learners must complete 30 hours of activities utilizing tools received to communicate a wide range of emotions when prompted.
Learners must participate in practice-based activities that focus on interacting with a diverse group of emotions.

55577fa4-4cdb-4806-b9c2-2d1cc0a271ce.description: Learners with this credential have engaged in a rigorous process that strengthens their ability to engage Black men and their families through the ongoing development of professional competencies and practical hands-on clinical experience. The Male Engagement Institute Practitioner Program supports learners by expanding their skill sets and clinical knowledge base. Learning opportunities support the evolving mental health needs of Black men, youth, and families.
55577fa4-4cdb-4806-b9c2-2d1cc0a271ce.name: Male Engagement Institute (MEI) Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must participate in the Male Engagement Institute Orientation.

Learners must complete the Integration of Race, Theory & Human Behavior Course. The Course assists Learners in utilizing theoretical frameworks to better assess and intervene with Black people in the Mental Health profession. The Course focuses on deepening their perspective of human behavior while using the expertise of Black scholars to establish a foundation for social work & psychological practice in various settings.

Learners must play an active role in Course discussions, complete reading assignments, and engage in discussions related to the Code of Ethics and the responsibilities of service providers in communities of color.
In consultation with the MEI Manager, Learners must complete a presentation on Black scholars studied during the Integration of Race, Theory and Human Behavior Course
Learners must complete the MEI Pre-Exam, Post-Exam, and Exit Survey

Learners must provide individual therapy, couples therapy, family therapy, or case management to men assigned to caseload to fulfill the required field hours upon completing the MEI Practitioner Program.

Hours completed working with persons served will vary based on the Learner's educational program. (Bachelor's Program: 400+ hrs, Masters' Program (1st Yr.): 480+ hrs, Masters' Program (2nd Yr.): 720+ hrs, Doctorate Program (1st Yr.): 640+ hrs., Doctorate Program (2nd Yr.): 800+ hrs). Upon completion of the MEI Practitioner Program, learners will be able to display expertise in working with men of color and their families in clinical settings.
Learners must complete all assignments that focus on theoretical frameworks created by experts in the Social Work, Psychology, and Theology fields.
Learners must participate in 40 hours of Individual Supervision with a therapist trained in the fatherhood, paternal health, and mental health fields.
Learners must participate in 30 hours of clinical group supervision with a multi-disciplinary team.

Learners must participate in all assigned agency tasks by the MEI Manager to complete requirements and gain experience in programming that focuses on mental and emotional health delivered to men of color and their families.
Learners must complete any school-based assignments, including but not limited to process recordings, competency papers, policy papers, learning contracts, and performance evaluations.

c3d4388b-6338-49b4-b7a8-3b49b332a0a8.description: Learners with this credential completed the National Ambassador Program. The National Ambassador Program stands on the premise that the successful preparation of Father Advocates in the Mental and Public Health Space is dependent on the ongoing access to opportunities that build on their hands-on experience. This course provided specific skills that mirror the barriers fathers experience when attempting to remain a part of their children's lives with limited resources.
c3d4388b-6338-49b4-b7a8-3b49b332a0a8.name: National Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete 443+ hours of community service geared toward advocating for fathers experiencing difficulties with remaining engaged in their children's lives.

Learners must complete 13 hours of instruction on a father's rights, establish paternity, child support modification, address false accusations, and navigate family and probate court matters in the Court Face Course.
Learners must participate in community service geared towards supporting fathers and their families.
Learners must have personally experienced being separated from a child or have mentored a father working to remain engaged in his children's life.
Learners must complete the Managing Emotions Course.
Learners must complete the Pre-Father Care Course.

Learners must complete a Personal Strength, Weakness, Opportunity, and Threat (SWOT) Analysis to identify opportunities for growth to enhance personal and professional skills. The shared experience of fighting to remain engaged or reconnect with their children is the foundation of being a National Ambassador.
Learners must agree to remain open to utilizing the network of clinicians, consultants, coaches, and other team members when needing guidance and support.

Learners must complete a Clifton Strength-based Assessment. This assessment is an essential part of helping National Ambassadors discover their top five strengths and can be used to improve Ambassador Culture and Ambassador engagement with Fathers throughout each phase of parenting in a healthy manner.
Learners must agree to maintain their dignity, self-respect, and integrity when of service to themselves and others.
Learners must receive a recommendation by a member of the Fathers’ UpLift team, a local partner, or an organization that has witnessed their leadership abilities.
Learners will supply evidence that they have applied procedures(13) learned to serve fathers with approved fatherhood and advocacy representative on an ongoing basis.

Learners must complete an Accountability Plan - National Ambassadors strongly believe in living a productive and healthy life, and identify self-care practices, coping skills, and social support as part of their accountability plan.
Court Face Graduate

d03487c9-19b3-4f15-956f-61ab1d155b99.description: Learners with this Badge have completed the Pre-Father Care Course. The Pre-Father Care Course covers practical knowledge, tools, and insight for fathers at any phase of their journey, including men on the verge of becoming a father/or thinking about having children. Pre-Father Care brings forth a new roadmap to reference during their parenting journeys. This engaging and interactive Course explores various phases of the fatherhood journey, self-parenting, and past trauma.
d03487c9-19b3-4f15-956f-61ab1d155b99.name: Pre-Father Care Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete the 18-session course.
Learners must complete all activities and assignments in a timely manner.
In partnership with Course instructors, Learners must complete a Co-parenting Plan in cases where unhealthy communication is present with the other parent.

1ae28b7a-4801-41a6-a929-7bc7ff14d316.description: Fathers' UpLift offers specialized pre-release and recovery-based services for men dealing with incarceration through its Homecoming Program. Learners with the Fathers' UpLift Homecoming Peer Credential have completed the 12-session course and received guidance in navigating challenges when re-entering society after incarceration. Learners also received support in identifying resources for others in similar situations as a peer.
1ae28b7a-4801-41a6-a929-7bc7ff14d316.name: Homecoming Peer

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete 12-hours of instruction geared towards successfully navigating the challenges connected to re-entering society after incarceration.
Learners must be willing to utilize lessons received to support others in need of assistance navigating the challenges of re-entering society after incarceration.
Learners must agree to remain open to utilizing the network of clinicians, consultants, coaches, and other team members when needing guidance and support.

Incarcerated men are eligible for services up to three months before their release date. The services at this stage include individualized goal planning, family reunification, and routine check-ins to discuss “becoming a better You” and resources needed upon release.

Learners, post-release, will be able to display their access to recovery-based services, including but not limited to therapeutic coaching services, individual and group treatment, and peer support on an ongoing and as-needed basis.
Learners must have a history of involvement in the jail and prison system and express an interest in being involved in a partnership with Fathers’ UpLift’s Homecoming Program.
Homecoming Program: Level 1 Graduate
Homecoming Program: Level 2 Graduate
Homecoming Program: Level 3 Graduate

4a1de4df-e8cf-444d-9f9e-b3feca784569.description: Fathers' UpLift offers specialized pre-release and recovery-based services for men dealing with incarceration through its Homecoming Program. Learners with this Fathers' UpLift Homecoming Program Credential have completed Level 1 of the 12-session course and received guidance in navigating challenges when re-entering society after incarceration.
4a1de4df-e8cf-444d-9f9e-b3feca784569.name: Homecoming Program: Level 1 Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: The learner completed the four sessions that were required for this badge.
The learner demonstrated a willingness to learn and be of service to others.

782ea4d9-616f-4829-ba7b-2242e2034d5e.description: Fathers' UpLift offers specialized pre-release and recovery-based services for men dealing with incarceration through its Homecoming Program. Learners with this Fathers' UpLift Homecoming Program Credential have completed Level 2 of the 12-session course and received guidance in navigating challenges when re-entering society after incarceration.
782ea4d9-616f-4829-ba7b-2242e2034d5e.name: Homecoming Program: Level 2 Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: The learner completed the four sessions that were required for this badge.
The learner demonstrated a willingness to learn and be of service to others.

b9fa3fc2-ab0d-4ac5-836c-3cb7239b3941.description: Fathers' UpLift offers specialized pre-release and recovery-based services for men dealing with incarceration through its Homecoming Program. Learners with this Fathers' UpLift Homecoming Program Credential have completed Level 3 of the 12-session course and received guidance in navigating challenges when re-entering society after incarceration.
b9fa3fc2-ab0d-4ac5-836c-3cb7239b3941.name: Homecoming Program: Level 3 Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: The learner completed the four sessions that were required for this badge.
The learner demonstrated a willingness to be of service to others.

54e9a3f1-65b6-41fa-961d-a98f8e1d9dd3.description: Learners with this badge have engaged in a hands-on introduction to the Human Service field through various learning modalities at Fathers' UpLift's Mental Health and Substance Abuse Treatment Facility, including but not limited to: observations, documentation, and the completion of assigned projects that meet the needs of Black men and their families. The Male Engagement Institute's (MEI) Human Service Internship supports learners in understanding micro and macro social work practice.
54e9a3f1-65b6-41fa-961d-a98f8e1d9dd3.name: Male Engagement Institute (MEI) Human Service Internship Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must support the Fathers’ Homecoming program by coordinating care for men returning to the community.
Learners must display a commitment to being of service to members of the community.
Learners must write meeting minutes when directed by agency leadership.

Learners must conduct research on various issues that impact fathers and families, including but not limited to: child support issues, housing issues, and record-friendly opportunities for those served.
Learners must contribute to other supporter-facing content that contributes to Fathers’ UpLift’s brand.
Learners must identify local and national resources and make referrals as needed.
Learners must participate in data collection activities.
Learners must rotate through various Departments within Fathers’ UpLift to provide support where needed and observe multiple components of the Human Service field.
Learners must observe Coaching and Ambassador sessions.
Learners must coordinate the packing and delivery of our signature Bags for Dads to fathers and local community partners.
Learners must work with team members to identify resource needs for fathers and families.

674cde1f-325a-4218-8676-0889929a49ef.description: This 18-week course focused on the elements of wellness, relapse prevention, and recovery. We provide opportunities for learners to identify the origin of unhealthy behaviors and implement a plan utilizing wellness and recovery-based practices to assist them with enhancing the quality of their lives. This course will also discuss the different paths to recovery, including but not limited to physical, mental, and emotional health, to promote the application of healthy practices in their lives.
674cde1f-325a-4218-8676-0889929a49ef.name: Wellness, Relapse Prevention & Recovery Graduate

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete 18 hours of instruction on wellness, relapse prevention, and recovery.
Learners must participate in practice-based activities that focus on wellness and recovery-based principles.
